question.title: How to disable encryption when using JDBC to connect to SQL server with TLSv1?
question.body:
There's an old SQL server running TLS 1.0 that I need to connect to

When I'm using sqlcmd I'm able to connect to it by skipping TLS with -N disable flag

But when attempting to connect using JDBC, I'm setting encrypt=false but it doesn't help, the connection still fails because TLS10 is not supported and only TLS12,TLS13 may be used.

How do I force the JDBC connection to disable encryption via DSN?
